reviewText: This cd is useless. Has stupid sayings. You would be better off recording your on on a phone. Make your own cd of what you want your bird to learn.
So many to chose from, Will have fun with this. My bird is enjoying  this, it also has a calming effect on her.

I invested in this great CD along with the 4 pack Special of Parrot Bird Training CD's to benefit my parrot and save on the cost of postage; as your online advertisement said free postage for orders for 25.00 or more. However I was charged for shipping.  Before this mishap I have been very pleased with Amazon for ordering things.  Hope you help me correct the problem.  I would rate this CD 5 Stars otherwise.
This is a great CD to help teach your birds some new words! I think its worth the money and so does my birds!
Very fast service. My parrots are still not saying anything new, but I will continue to use it with the hope that after many repetitions they will pick up some more words.
my birds love this they have started taking and saying some words I think the more I play it the more they will learn
Not exactly what I was looking for but still very pleased with this CD.  I just really need to spend more time playing it.  Birds seem entertained.

I suppose the CD would be effective if played constantly. I just didn't expect it to be so slow and boring. I do put it on when I leave the room with high expectations of my bird learning to talk. I can't listen to it.

If you want your bird to interact with you, then interact with your bird. Parrots have the mental capacity of a 3-5 year old child. This is like plopping your child down in front of the TV and calling it quality time. Parrots learn to communicate dynamically not by rote. I have 5 parrots and all are chatty because we chat, while cleaning, cooking, doing laundry.. whatever. Turn off the TV and read aloud, talk, sing, dance.. be one of the flock.

Really like this CD. You can choose to repeat whatever phrase you want your bird to say. Or just play the entire CD. Wish some of the phrases provided included the word "parakeet" since it includes others such as cockatiel or parrot.
summary: Teach your bird to talk CD

reviewText: good for what it is and the price.  but the repetition has made my parrot go a little beserk.
The vocals are said in a very dull way. It needs to be said in an interesting way for the bird to want to listen. It consequently has not been useful for my two birds.

This is the biggest waste of money - do not buy it - it will not work!

It's just people saying a certain word, then a 10 second pause ... then a different word and another 10 second pause.  You can create your own if you really want to try this.

But you really should not leave this on for your bird all day - it should be done in 10 minute intervals only or your bird may get irritated by it (i know i get irritated by it after only 2 words).

Don't waste your money on this.

seriously, buy a tape recorder and just play it continuously to your bird. at least then, it will be your own voice he's hearing and not just some random person saying 'hello' over and and over again. i'm sure repitition is good for them to learn, but i paid $11.99 for this? the entire cd is made up of random words or phrases all about 3-5 seconds long. the idea is to choose the one you want your bird to learn and then put the that track of the cd on repeat. it makes sense, but really, couldn't you do it yourself for free? also, alot of the words are things i wouln't want him to learn anyway, just random stuff you wouldn't normally even say yourself.

I believe this CD will help train any bird that is capable of speaking.
Linda from Pennsylvania
summary: Feathered Phonics The Easy Way to Teach Your Bird to Speak Volume 1

reviewText: WE HAVE HAD THIS FOR A COUPLE OF WEEKS. I HAVE A TWO MCCAWS ONE 8 YEARS OLD THE OTHER 14 WEEKS. SO FAR THE LITTLE ONE WILL MIMIC ALL OF HIS BIGGER SISTERS BAD HABITS BUT THE CD SEEMS TO BE INEFFECTIVE. THE WORD OF THE DAY IS BYE BYE BYE BYE. I SUGGEST NOT BEING HOME DURING THIS EVENT :)
summary: MY WIFE AND I HAVE LEARNED SOME NEW WORDS

reviewText:
My impressions of Fatherree's book:

Pros --

-- The photos are almost without exception beautiful and help to explain and illustrate points the author is trying to make.

-- Chapter 6 ("Tridacnid troubles) sets out a good amount of information on diseases that I have never seen in any other place.

-- The third chapter, on identification of the various species, is very useful, clear and well done overall.  The photos in this chapter are invaluable and beautiful.

Cons --

-- The "conversational style" is something a reader may like, or may not. I did not.  I want a clear explanation of a topic, not a conversation with someone who is trying to be casual, witty and amusing for reasons that don't help the explanation along.  The author is apparently trying, in part, to make the book entertaining enough so that the reader wants to learn about the subject; virtually anyone who buys this book, though, already has enough interest in the subject to sustain them through the reading of the book.

-- The text on pages 130 and 131 is juxtaposed one with the other.

-- The chapter that many readers would want to be the most complete and cutting-edge (that on care of clams in the aquarium, Chapter 5) is the least informational of the book.  The worst section in that chapter is probably the section on lighting.  This section includes absolutely no mention of lighting intensity in any usably objective terms (PAR or even lux), and wastes five paragraphs with a repetitive monologue of his subjective opinions on the 'looks' of various color temperature bulbs.  This chapter also includes a section on feeding, which spends ALL of its ten pages explaining how, how much, what and when to feed, only to conclude with the recommendation "if you want to avoid all of this, just do what I've done for years (as have a gazillion other hobbyists) and only keep tridacnids in well-established, well-stocked aquariums with bright lights and don't worry about them.(p. 183)"  It should also be pointed out that the book devotes most of Chapter 2 to why Tridacnids need not be fed at all!  Lastly, there was no information in the chapter on care of clams that is not currently what passes for common knowledge in the hobby.  While this is fine, in the sense that a book can be usefully a compilation of common practices, I expected more.

In summary: a book that most interested hobbyists will find is worth owning, in spite of the fact that it falls short of a bar that has been set by recent books in the hobby, including Wilkerson's "Clownfishes", Borneman's "Aquarium Corals" and the three volumes of Delbeek and Sprung's "The Reef Aquarium".
summary: Good, but a bit overrated by other reviewers

reviewText: Put simply, if you are interested in purchasing a clam, buy and read this book first.  You will more than likely save money in the long-run.  In any event, you will have the go-to book on hand when problems and questions arise.  The book is written in clear language and with a wry sense of humor.  Recommended without qualification.
summary: Your Clam Insists That You Purchase This Book

reviewText: I have met James personally and had the pleasure of having him speak for our marine club (DFWMAS).  James knows Tridacnids and his book offers the most comprehensive up-to-date information on the care for Tridacnids.  This is a must have book for all Tridacnid clam owners.
Book covers everything from how to chose what to feed and differences of all of the species.  Lots of great knowledge!
summary: Great book with lots of knowledge.

reviewText: finish reading this book in 2 days. this book covers pretty much everything from the caring to selection of tridacnid clams. i hv 5 clams in my reef tank. this book has really taught me a lot of things i hv overlooked such as feeding. i highly recommend this book.

This is the best and most updated book about tridacnid clams you can get today, including excellent photos as well.

I bought my copy at MACNA 2006 (Houston), from James himself.

Chapters are:

1. Tridacnid Biology Basics

2. Tridacnid Nutrition

3. The Tridacnid Species

4. Collecting, Farming, and Shipping Tridacnids

5. The Acquisition and Care of Tridacnids

6. Tridacnid Troubles
My cats love all these DVD's.  Especially volume 1 (That is the volume that seems to have more variety.)

I purchased the Trilogy with hoping my two cats, age 3 and 5 would be interested.  The 3 yr old cat was fascinated for about 15 minutes but when the same pictures came on, she got bored.  The 5 year old watched for about a few minutes but then walked away. It is possible that because we have a wonderful courtyard full of greenery and trees and one of my neighbors has a bird feeder, that there is enough going on outside that they prefer real life versus a taped version.  I will more than likely pass this on to a friend who has cats that don't have as much wildlife to watch as mine do.
summary: Nice Distraction for my cats for about 15 minutes

reviewText: A big collection for a little cat but she seems to really enjoy them.  maybe could have just got one but was a good deal.

My indoor cat doesn't 'watch' them but I do like to have them playing in the house when I'm gone. My roommate actually likes to have the bird video on when she's home reading... It's disappointing that all 3 have the same bird sound effects (even with the fish and mice). Good price compared to the pet stores.

When I bought this combo, it was more expensive than the 3 DVDs bought separately. Unfortunately, I saw it too late. My bad. But where's the logic ?

Then my cats didn't like those DVDs. Well, more like "not interested" than "don't like". TV off or Cat Sitter is the same.

And really those DVDs are cheap. Always the same videos, the same animals, the same noises. I mean, what's the point of hearing birds if we are seeing fish ???

I was more entertained by those DVDs than my cats.

My cat literally begs and pleads to watch her movies, she sits on her stand and is captivated for hours until she attempts to become part of the movie and falls off her perch! LOL!  This will provide endless hours of entertainment for both you and your pet.
summary: My Cat Is a Couch Potatoe!!

reviewText: Now she is not so jealous and doesn't interupt me - too much, when I am on the computer.

They came to me right away, so the shipper of this product is very good.

I gave the volume 1 dvd to a friend and one of his cats love it. The 2nd and 3rd volumes I will keep for my cats. So far they seem to dig it.
AWESOME!  I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THE SERVICE AND THE ITEMS ORDERED.  THANX!

I never would have believed my cats would actually be interested in watching videos, but they did! They were transfixed in front of the TV. I found it very helpful to get them something to sit on that got them closer to the screen. They particularly like vol. 2 with all the birds. My husband and I watched them watching the video, but then we began watching it and found it very soothing and relaxing, almost a meditative experience. So I would have to say it was a great entertaining buy for the whole "family" !!
My cats love it lol
I received this and it is working good, cat's like

love.......love.......love......love.......love......love.......love......love.......my boy really loves this......thank you very much....just love it........my boy is a five year old male black cat who is a very active cat.....he really loves this
Really wish that I had just purchased volume one. It is the best.  based on what my cats preferred. It is hysterical watching your cat as they watch the video. worth every penny!!!!

When I first put in the DFD the cats weren't sure what to make of it but within 10 minutes they were sitting on the floor under the TV just staring at the screen. Eventually they started pawing at the screen. The funniest part is when one of the birds fly off screen. They would start looking all around to see where it went. I try not to overuse it because they do get bored over time, but whenever they get too mischievous I put the DVD in and they come running from wherever they are. Amazing.

reviewText: The cat likes all three DVDs, but she likes volume three the best (with the volume turned down low).  One day she will learn that the animals are not inside the television

Even very young kittens are fascinated with the CDs. I bought these for my daughter who rescues and rehabilitates homeless kittens. The CD's are used constantly. There is a little TV in the cat room just for them. The butterflys and birds keep the kittens occupied and happy ( along with lots of toys and yummy food.) Buy them for your new kitten (or older cat) to make her environment stimulating and exciting.

reviewText: Purchased this cat DVD for our active cat.  Hoping that it would keep his attention long enough to give me a break from playing with him.  I have to say that the first DVD is the only one that captures his attention for about 10-20 minutes.  The other DVD's he doesn't even look at.  Maybe I just have a cat that is just too active to sit still...I don't know.  I would recommend the first DVD only if you are thinking of trying it.  Great price and fast delivery.

My one year old cat loves this series. For the first 5 minutes he tried to eat the tv, then stalked the cables behind it. After that, he sat quietly with all attention laser focused on the screen. He has never been still this long while awake. The butterflies and mice are particular favorites. Very helpful for hours away from home or when you just need to work without interruption.

I bought this for my parents cat which I take care of when they are out of town.  I use a laptop computer on the floor and turn it on.  He likes the rats the best and at first tried to see where they were coming from -- looking behind the computer screen etc.  Now he watches the video until he is so tired he can't keep awake -- then he pushes the lap top screen flat on the rug and lays on top.  I think he does that so the rats and birds can't get out without waking him up.
  I did not think about the dog liking this video until I saw him laying close to the computer and watching the cat interact with the video.  He doesn't want to leave the area -- even to follow me around the house like he does when no video is playing.

  Great buy  --a must have -- if they make a 4th volume I hope it has more cats on it.  Our cat likes the  Producers cut  that has just cats on it . Instead of batting at the screen he rolls over like he wants to be friends -- today he rolled off the bed.  I bought the video for him but the whole housewhole loves to watch him enjoy it.
summary: cat loves it -- dogs loves watching the cat watch the video

reviewText: My cats actually watched these DVDs. In the beginning they tried to get the birds by reaching behind the television but once they got used to the deal they settled down and just watched intently.  It was funny when a bird would fly out of the picture the cats would want to dart that way too.

Our two indoor cats are both drawn in by these videos. We put them on when we are going to be gone awhile,but don't use them all the time to kept them interested. You might find yourself watching the videos along with your cats!

This is the same DVD series someone had given me back in 2007 and it stinks.  The camera moves too much, jerking around and I could have made a better video using my cell phone.  Only one of the 3 videos is remotely interesting to my cat, the same video she liked back in 2007 but after 10 min., she too is bored.  I cannot watch it, it makes me dizzy.

I bought the triliogy and have tested out all the DVDs.  It appears that volume 2 is the most well received of the three and the one I would recommend.  It's funny to watch my cat watch it bc she looks behind the TV trying to find the birds.  I turn this on sometimes when I'm leaving the house, by the time I get home, she doesn't seem to be paying attention anymore but figured she'd at least enjoy the sounds.

My four fur babies love these tapes.  In the morning after breakfast we push the foot stools up to the tv and they sit there for at least a hour watching these.  They enjoy them as well as we do we have been able to take some great pictures of them sitting and playing.

Birds, butterflies, rats, hamsters and fish - my cat loves it all! He's obsessed with the screen and so exited by the images that have engaging sounds and change frequently enough to keep his attention--and mine!

Two of three of the videos are interesting for my cat.  For some reason he does not care for the
fish one.  His attention span covers about half of one of the videos.  Overall, this is a good
product, but I could have gotten by with just the first single video.

Good for kitty's but too many and too long in the testimonials

We bought it already so who needs that!  Otherwise great for home alone kitty's .

My cat loves the video of the birds most; the fish video plays bird sounds constantly and he became bored with it. Need to replay the "rodent" portion to see his reaction. One thing is for sure - he's now very interested in Animal Planet-SPCA stories and watches the horses, dogs, etc. get rescued. Would love to have a video that is Blu-Ray quality. Pretty cute.Cat Sitter DVD Trilogy - Vol 1, Vol 2 and Vol 3
summary: Pleased with purchase, with some comments

reviewText: I bought this video on the advice of a dear friend that runs a pet sitting business. I am retired and spend a lot of time doing volunteer work. When I moved to a place that would allow pets I adopted a 5 year old five toed cat!! She has become the love of my life. I felt guilty leaving her alone, so I ordered the video. She LOVES it!! Being an indoor cat it gives her the feel of being outdoors. When I get ready to leave the apartment she sits in front of the TV and looks at the DVD player and then the TV and meows until I set up the video for her!! She could be sound asleep, but when a certain part of the video comes on, she jumps up and stares at the TV hoping to catch the bluebird!! Highly recommend!
summary: My cat meows for this video!

reviewText: If I had gotten just volume two, I would have given it five stars, but since I got the trilogy, I can only give it three stars.  I read all the reviews, and knew that vol. two was the best, hands down, but for few extra dollars I decided to get all three in a combo pack.  Since birds are a natural source of food for cats (feral) it was natural that they were instantly attracted to vol. two. Contrary to all the cartoons, cats are not fishermen, and thus, fish, either in a bowl or in the wild are not something they are naturally attracted to. Since gerbils and guinea pigs are not native where I live, they could have been little dogs as far as my cats could tell. Rodents are also a natural food, so volume one was much better than volume three. Also, the quality could have been better (for my eyes only) but my cats could care less about video quality... they just see birds..  LOL

Both of our male, grey tabby, white pawed cats are fascinated by the various animals and their movement in these videos. Excellent entertainment for them. A worthwhile investment that I highly recommend.

My two year old Egyptian mau kitten loves watchng birds, at first she loved watching the birds over and over, and now she knows that it is a dvd.

Terri

Never in a million years would I have believed that these videos would work on cats...but I was willing to be a gambler and try them.  THEY DO!

I have five cats which pretty much live in different areas of the house because they don't get along.  I bought the three DVD set and was amazed at how quickly my cats became addicts.  One cat will ask me to play this for him by sitting at the TV and looking at me.  If I turn on the DVD and he's in another room he will high tail it over asap just to perch near the TV to watch.  These are simply amazing.
they are great, i have a cat who now watches tv news as well as the dvds made for him.  good job

My female kitty could care less about these videos-but she cares less about almost everything. My little male however digs these. He doesn't go ape over them, but he really does watch them for a bit and it makes me feel better to throw them on when I have to go out to work and leave him.

If you have a cat, you definitely need the cat sitter dvds.  My cats have turned into couch potatoes.  They want the dvd turned on each morning before I leave for work.  Their favorite is volume I.  My cats are very happy with the dvd's.  Your cats will love it.

reviewText:
I'm a certificated Behavioral Therapist for Dogs from The Netherlands. I had to rate this show with 1 star in order to be able to comment on it, but I think 1 star is too much.

I watched Cesar's show several times on TV. I think his methods are very old fashioned. Why use corrections if you can teach dogs things in a positive and non-threatening way.

The Dutch association of Behavioral Therapists has officially protested against the broadcasting of Cesar's show.

Cesar should watch Victoria Stilwell's show. She teaches dogs and owners how to deal with problems in a positive and ethological way.
summary: Someone should teach Cesar a lesson!

reviewText: I'VE OWNED AND TRAINED DOGS FOR 20 YEARS AND HAVE USED MANY DIFFERENT NON ABUSIVE METHODS TO WORK WITH PROBLEM DOGS,  AND I BELIEVE CESARS APPROACH IS NOT ONLY THE MOST SIMPLE AND HUMANE BUT IT WORKS.  HE SHOWS HOW SIMPLE CORRECTIONS CAN BRING ABOUT INSTANT RESULTS WITHOUT HAVING TO BE AGGRESSIVE OR ABUSIVE TO THE ANIMAL.  I'M NOT SURE WHAT BOOK OR PROGRAM THE OTHER REVIEWER IS WATCHING, BECAUSE ANYONE WHO IS CONSISTENT WITH CESARS TECHNIQUES WILL GET THE DESIRED RESULTS.  I'VE WATCHED HIS PROGRAM SINCE THE BEGINNING AND HAVE ADDED HIS BOOK TO THE MANY OTHERS I REFER TO IN MY WORK.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIS BOOK TO ANYONE WHO WANTS TO HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR DOG!!
summary: THE BEST WAY IS CESARS WAY

reviewText:
The poster who stated that Cesar's methods are archaic and use pain to correct the dogs obviously hasn't spent time watching the show.

Cesar never causes the dogs any pain or injury. In fact, several of the dogs on his show have bitten holes in his hands but he never, never reacts in a way that is painful to the dog. He maintains his calm assertive self.

Cesar's corrections consist of a noise "shhhh" and a brief tug on the leash. Cesar works with the type of collar the owner has on the dog. That may be buckle, choke, martingale, or pinch/prong. None of Cesar's corrections are physically damaging to the dog. Incidentally, the prong/pinch collar is not a cruel device when used correctly. It is meant as a TRAINING AID, to be used for no more than 2 weeks to help gain control of larger dogs that need help mastering leash etiquette. A person should ALWAYS consult a professional trainer for information on the proper use of pinch/prong collars. Shock collars should never be used unless they are set on a "beep" only setting and under the supervision of a professional.

Please, if you own a dog, watch this show! This DVD set is filled with valuable information about canines and our relationship with them. Cesar gives good information in a no nonsense way that anyone can follow. The first season was wonderful, and you can bet I'm going to tune in for season two! Our canines need an advocate like Cesar.

I'd give this two thumbs up!

I am a veterinarian and I see many behavioral problems.  I have euthanized many animals that have taken control of their owners. I am also a college biology instructor and I can assure you that Cesar's methods are right on.  Dogs are pack animals, all of them, from pekinese to border collie.  They can never escape their genetic background as pack dominated social animals.  Cesar uses that pack energy to establish order.  The person who talks about pain and intimidation never watched the show.  His methods are far more humane than prong collars and crates.  I have used his techniques with my clients and have had great success.  I thank him daily.  Be the pack leader, watch this DVD

Cesar Milan has gentle, effective techniques for taming just

about any dog, but the owner needs to listen carefully and

learn from Cesar's advice to the people.  As he says, the

people are the ones who need training to learn how to handle

their animals.  I have been training dogs for 30 years and

have learned more from two seasons of Dog Whisperer shows than

from literally hundreds of dog training books, seminars, tapes,

etc.  that I have experienced.  Cesar truly has the answer.

Listen when he whispers and you won't be disappointed.

All I have to say is that this show is phenominal.  Every dog "parent" should watch this show.  I can't stop talking about it -- ever since I saw Cesar on Oprah last year.  It's not just about problem dogs.  Cesar "trains human and rehabilitates dogs" - and he's not kidding.  Even though my dog doesn't have any serious issues, I still find Cesar and his teachings inspiring.  I'll find myself out with the dog and think to myself, "What would Cesar do?!"  Not only does this show teach dog owners a thing or two, but it's also leaves the viewer with a warm fuzzy feeling!  All hail Cesar!!!

Mom recorded a bunch of shows in a not-so-subtle hint because I have a two extremely high-energy border-collie/retriever mixes--wilder than previous dogs I've had.

I was hooked!

Cesar's messages are very, very compatible with standard 4H dog training. He presents it in a very understandable way though on TV.

I noted he was very specific on "putting out the calm, assertive energy" --which some of Millan's book readers took literally & grew angry that he didn't explain how to grow that "magic energy" or whatever... He means carry your face, hands, body & voice in a very calm, quiet, assertive manner, like a top executive, not like a scared, shivering little girl, or an aggressive mean Tasmanian Devil, or a Flapping Bozo the Clown. Note this works on people too.

I wholeheartedly agree on exercise working like Dog (& human) Prozac, and it creates a more manageable dog. 4H, again! It also works to control anxiety & concentration in humans & animals.

I never thought about dog backpacks and have HUGE hopes for it. I'd been trying to think of something that'd wear them down a bit. Currently, I have to struggle and fight my way to the 4th lap around the block---by then, they are much calmer & easier to walk. They are easy to walk by themselves, but maybe that pack mentality makes them nutso together. If I leave one at home, he screams, jumps on the window.

On one show, he had the dog pull a skateboarder or roller-skating person. My sister had great results with her boxer pulling her on skates--(use a helmet & guards).

Note on his show, there is a frequent disclaimer: "Do not attempt by yourself, get a professional to help you."

I totally agree with this--I've seen people totally misinterpret things on their own in totally goofy, usually lazy & self-serving ways and the pet is the ultimate victim.

  Beware of worthless trainers where you walk in, and all the dogs are dragging the owners around like sled-dogs.
Cesar Milan is awesome!
He never disappoints!

What can I say... I love Cesar Millan!  I am a little late coming to the party... I just got cable TV for the first time in my life ( I'm in my sixties), so I missed all of his TV shows when they were actually on.  Now that I have had cable for a while, I am finding that they appear to only have a select amount of episodes, and they are beginning to repeat.  BUT I GOTTA SEE THEM ALL!!!  So I will buy the seasons on DVD as I can afford them, then I can have a Cesar fix anytime I need one.  What a terrific guy he must be!  I watched the anniversary episode where they brought Lassie to meet him (she is apparently His hero), and I sat here alone in my living room and cried like a little girl, which I no longer am.  I see from buzzing around Amazon that he also has books that tell his story from when he was a young boy with his grandfather.  I hope I get to read them, too.  How many animals set for euthanasia has he saved?!  What  a wonderful guy he must be!  Hail, Cesar!!!

reviewText: Gifted it to my sister because she's trying to learn about dogs before she actually gets one...

Great DVD! I don't have cable so haven't been able to see the show that I have heard about until I bought the DVDs (I purchased seasons 1 and 2) at the same time. I absolutely love Cesar and just admire his ability! I have a puppy and have to keep watching these DVDs to see what I am doing wrong. Ugh... I only wish a couple of the episodes dealt directly with puppies. All the dogs in these DVDs are grown dogs that have bad habits and he comes in to rehabilitate the dogs and train the owners how to be pack leaders. Although I know it is harder to train a dog with bad habits than it is to train a puppy, puppies are just different and more like juvenile delinquents. Cesar can take any dog with any bad characteristics and within hours (or in the TV world "within minutes" is more accurate), you will see a completely different dog. He is just remarkable! Before a couple of episodes I have thought, "How in the world will Cesar be able to address that problem?" I have not seen a single problem that he hasn't been able to address.

I try to use the same techniques on my puppy, but the key is consistency and frankly after a full day in the office, I often lack the energy to chase after him constantly. I guess it's my own fault if my puppy is a juvenile delinquent because the techniques that Cesar uses actually work. He emphasizes calm assertive energy, which works very well. If I yell at my puppy he either runs and hides under a table or he can get very rambunctious at times and barks at me as if he wants to fight it out - LOL. If I remain calm and assertive and use the techniques that Cesar teaches, my puppy will instantly change his behavior. The problem is that he isn't always at my side and if I see him chewing on something across the room I instantly yell at him to get him to stop the behavior. It works at the moment, but at the end of the day, he won't consider me his pack leader if I continue down that road. That is quite evident when he chooses to bark back at me. Pack leaders of dogs in the wild are always calm and in control.

Cesar is so educated on the topic of dogs I continue to learn something every time I watch an episode. I even watch them a second time because even though I got it the first time, I often don't follow though exactly as he does. Sometimes the little things make all the difference. Cesar is also very easy on the eyes and has a cute accent to go with it, which make the DVDs even that much more enjoyable if you're a woman. If our a man, you will have to be happy with just the learning portion of it :-)
Cesar's methods have been working great with our Shiba Inu who used to be a challenge to walk.  Love the show!
This guy is AWESOME!! He knows what he's talking about. I would love for him to come to my house.
this was a used item and i got it very quickly and it played great i enjoyed it a lot
The dvd is fantastic, more knowledge to learn for us novice and experience dog owners. As far as the delivery, etc. The set came quickly and wrapped well.

We have been interested in Cesar's way of training dogs and decided to collect his series a season at a time.  I makes sense to call on mother nature for instructions and the result is a well balanced happy dog.  The disks arrived promptly, were well packaged and in good condition.  Many thanks.
summary: Cesar is the dog's best friend

reviewText: I was saddened by the news that Cesar fell on hard emotional times. But I found it so inspiring to hear his fans brought him back to his senses, and the love of his family. It would be a sad day indeed if we lost the wisdom of "The Dog Whisperer"! I LOVE this series of which I bought all! I learn something new every time I watch with the added bonus of watching the extra good looking Cesar take the head of the pack. Please continue your art as your fans applaud your amazing work. We love you Cesar!
summary: I love Cesar and so does my sister!!

reviewText: Please see the other reviews we've written about "Dog Whisperer." The show is great, both educational and entertaining. And Amazon needs to develop a way to rate multiples of the same thing! Why write the same review for every year's episodes of "Dog Whisperer"???

reviewText: I bought a used copy of the first season of the Dog Whisperer and watched it entirely in two days. I was pleased with the quality of the product. It was used but it was still in good shape. I would have preferred for it to have arrived at my house quicker, though.
season one was well made.  A good start to the show.  He makes things easy to understand.  Easy to watch.

I gave 5 stars because I think Millan is right on with psychological aspect of training, and not just the dog, but the owner as well. I have learned alot from his show. Dog obedience is a must as well but when your dog has a problem you need to look futher into what the cause is just as you would a child.
What Cesar is able to accomplish with these puppers is miraculous.  Truly, I feel as though I'm witnessing a miracle whenever I watch him.
There is no better training tool for the dog owner in trouble than Dog Whisperer. Caesar is an intuitive and masterful dog owner and trainer.

The DVD set came sooner than I expected and was in perfect condition. I don't have cable anymore so I have missed mostly all of this program, so this was a real treat! Now I am saving my pennies to buy the next season! This dealer was awesome and I would definitely recommend him to anyone!
